results.title: Good things come in small packages
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leeanne Hill and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Sam came up to Leeanne Hill and asked her for a hug, a friendship started that has only become stronger over the years. These best friends are there for each other through everything, including Hill’s struggle with Turner’s Syndrome.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Leeanne Hill and ACMI

results.title: Turning perceptions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karlene Lynch and ACMI
results.brief_description: Karlene Lynch found out when she was 21 that she had Turner’s Syndrome. Despite the agony of being infertile and the health difficulties, Lynch has led a happy and inspiring life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karlene Lynch and ACMI
results.description: Karlene Lynch found out when she was 21 that she had Turner’s Syndrome. Despite the agony of being infertile and the health difficulties, Lynch has led a happy and inspiring life.

results.title: Turner's Syndrome : trials and triumphs
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jackie Breasley and ACMI
results.brief_description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jackie Breasley and ACMI
results.description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.

results.title: Diary of a backpack
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Gabrielle Guaran and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Gabrielle Guaran and ACMI
results.description: Gabrielle Guaran’s backpack tells of all the adventures taken with her owner, a woman with Turner’s Syndrome. Depsite getting old, Guaran hasn’t given up on her backpack, in much the same way she refuses to give up on the life she wants to lead.

results.title: Dr Phil's story
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Phil Bergman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Phil Bergman and ACMI
results.description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.

results.title: Art 4 Starts
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sonya Waters and ACMI
results.brief_description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sonya Waters and ACMI
results.description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sally McCutcheon and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Sally McCutcheon and ACMI
